page.title: 19THE WARMINSTER CIVIC TRUST
page.content:
Founded in 1972 by architect Peter Wakefield after a successful street improvement scheme, Warminster Civic Trust has about 200 members in 1985. They are local people interested in improving the town environment, especially in the centre where most of the historic buildings are, and which has become a Conservation Area.
The Trust's work is entirely done by volunteers. Recent Trust activities include a Warminster Common landscape plan which won a special commendation, and an investigation into street litter which showed most was dropped on the routes to schools!
Executive Committee member Mr John Cole says that the most important issue for the Trust in 1985 is the new by-pass and its effects on the town.
